intro: Tambourissa peltata, commonly known as the broadleaf tambourissa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or red when mature. Tambourissa peltata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
